step.context: %text In the given problem, is it possible to compute $A^T-B$? %
step.reason: %text Only matrices of the same order (rows $\times$ columns) can be added or subtracted. Therefore $B (2\times 3)$ cannot be subtracted from $A^T (3\times 2)$ %

%text In taking transpose of a matrix, we change the $i^{th}$ row to the $i^{th}$ column for every row in the matrix. % \begin{align} A^T-B^T &= \left[\begin{array}{rr} 3 & 4 \\ -1 & 2 \\ 0 & 1 \end{array}\right]- \left[\begin{array}{rr} -1 & 1 \\ 2 & 2 \\ 1 & 3 \end{array}\right] \\ &=\left[\begin{array}{rr} 4 & 3 \\ -3 & 0 \\ -1 & -2 \end{array}\right] \end{align}
